attributes.action: Stop the creation of a female offenders centre on Porthcawl's seafront.
attributes.additional_details: There are many isolated spots away from residential areas and the temptations offered by a busy seaside holiday resort. As the Armed Forces are to be drastically reduced in number, a large number of more suitable locations will be coming onto the market.
attributes.background: Look for somewhere more suitable. People come to Porthcawl to enjoy themselves, not to be punished. This proposal will have a devastating effect on our town and its tourism industry.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition Bridgend County Borough Council has stated that a representative of the Ministry for Justice has confirmed they will not be submitting planning applications for a new Wales Residential Women’s Centre at Sunnyside House in Bridgend town centre or the Atlantic Hotel in Porthcawl.

You can read the Council's full statement here: https://www.bridgend.gov.uk/news/update-on-proposed-centre-for-women-offenders/
